alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Montgomery; Pulaski (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 11:57PM EDT until June 17 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Radford, Floyd, Montgomery and Pulaski. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1156 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Even though it has stopped raining in some areas, runoff from previous rain continues. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Carper Branch, Connellys Run, Calhoun Run, Brush Creek, Big Indian Creek, Boothe Creek, Crab Creek, Bentley Branch, Beaverdam Creek, Altoona Branch, Back Creek and Beaver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Christiansburg... Radford... Pulaski... Dublin... Pilot... Copper Hill... Childress... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
